p: Structure analyses on both datasets showed that the Black Sea populations are genetically distinct (Evanno method; K = 2) from sub-Saharan Aaf, clustering within Aaa populations (Figs. 4a, 5a). Subsequently, within Aaa, Black Sea clusters first with Asia (Figs. 4b, 5b) and then as a distinct group (Figs. 4c, 5c). Structure analyses on the smaller datasets, normalizing the number of populations per region with those of the Black Sea region, confirmed that the Black Sea is of the Aaa typeÂ (Additional file 1: Figure S1) and according to the Evanno et al. method [ 30], forms a distinct group within this range (Additional file 1: Figure S2).
